did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Three daybooks from Christiansburg wholesaler in feed, seed and other agricultural products, providing names, dates, goods purchased, and prices for each transaction.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: The copyright status of this collection is unknown. Copyright restrictions may apply. Contact Special Collections and University Archives for assistance in determining the use of these materials. Reproduction or digitization of materials for personal or research use can be requested using our reproduction/digitization form: http://bit.ly/scuareproduction. Reproduction or digitization of materials for publication or exhibit use can be requested using our publication/exhibition form: http://bit.ly/scuapublication. Please contact Special Collections and University Archives (specref@vt.edu or 540-231-6308) if you need assistance with forms or to submit a completed form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: [identification of item], [box], [folder], Harkrader Produce Company Account Books, Ms1940-014, Special Collections and University Archives, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Harkrader Produce Company Account Books were aquired by Newman Library prior to 1941.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Harkrader Produce Company Account Books commenced and was completed in February 2011.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Harkrader Produce Company was established by Robert R. and Paul D. Hardrader at 106 North Franklin Street in Christiansburg, Virginia, in the 1920s. The business seems to have been a wholesaler, emphasizing on seed, but also sold feed, fertilizer, poultry and other agricultural products. The Harkrader Produce Company closed in 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of three daybooks from the Harkrader Produce Company, a Christiansburg, Virginia wholesaler of feed, seed and other agricultural products. Each volume contains entries detailing transaction dates, names of purchasers, goods purchased, and prices.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Material
relatedmaterial.p: See also the Harkrader & Sarver Account Books, Ms1940-029 from Special Collections and University Archives.

odd.head: Rights Statement for Archival Description
